answers.answer: Get a liver panel done. (It's a simple blood test.)

The "liver panel" blood test will indicate if there is a problem.  If the doctor says you have elevated liver enzymes that means your liver is inflamed. "Fatty Liver" might be a possible diagnosis for you.  Cut way back on you fat intake.   Is your doctor at all concerned that you might have gestational diabetes?  Have you been checked for this?
I haven't been tested for gestational diabetes yet.  I think they will do that next month.  Do you think that may cause the liver to be enlarged?

It's complicated.  IF you have fatty infiltration of the liver that means that your cells are not handling fat in a proper way.  You might have insulin resistance.  Insulin resistance is what people get 10 - 15 years before they get diabetes.  ( I have insulin resistance and fatty infiltration of the liver.  I have had two Glucose tolerence tests and many, many other tests, like MRI's and ultrasounds.  I even have the fatty deposits in my kidneys.)Anyway, the doctors don't have any pills that they can prescribe for this condition.  It is in the research stage right now.  Articles have been published in the New England Journal of Medicine this year about NONALCOHOLIC STEATOHEPATITIS.  The doctors don't know what causes it.  The only thing you can do is adopt a healthy lifestyle.  Diet and exercise as if you already have diabetes.  30 minutes of exercise every day and count your fat grams.

I have had problems for years with so many different things.  I had endometriosis and they are finding that GI problems are related to endometriosis.  I am severly constipated and have spasms that cause the food that I eat to turn into insulin.  I have had every test that is known to the GI world and have been diagnosed with Diabetes 2, Gastrointestinal Motor Dysfunction, Bacterial overgrowth, Ampulla of Vadar Deuadanal Wall spasms and everything else.  I have also been diagnosed with NASH.  It is a Non-Alcoholic Serosus Hepatitus which makes my liver count go up.  I also have inflmation in my heart veins from high cholesterol levels.  Sometimes I think I will never get out of theis box I am living in.  I am in pain most of the time and have trouble breathing and have a pain that starts under my ribcage on my left side.  I am bloated and can go for 2 months without a bowel movement.  I take 8 ducolox at night and sometimes they do not help me either.  I have a good Dr. and he says it is a neurolgical problem and that I have a missing gene.  What in the world is he talking about?  Can anyone help me?

Avoid all Hydrogenated and partially hydrogenated oils and fats.  If you are diligent and read all packaged food labels and eliminate them from your diet you will feel a little better.  Your liver cannot process the hydrogenated oils.  When I eliminated them I lost twenty pounds, my cholesterol went back to normal and my liver enzymes returned to a normal range.  I have my blood checked every month.  I hope this information is helpful to you.  Good luck.  (You can find good foods at the health food stores that do not contain hydrogenated oils.)

Hi, wow, I am getting alot of good info on here tonight, I'm so glad to have found this board!  roxnsox, you seem to be so informed, I have learned alot reading your responses, thanks!  My doctor seems to think I have fatty liver, I have raised liver enzymes ALT is 88 (range 0-50), and AST is 37 (range 2-35).  I had a sonogram that showed fatty infiltration of the liver, and all other tests (blood work) came back normal, I was a little high on something called Polys, which was 78 (range 40-74).  Anyway, I liked my former GI, who has left the area, he seemed to think he was sure that I had a fatty liver, and just said to loose weight and come back in six months to see if they drop.  The thing is, I went to another GI to ask about a liver cleansing diet, and he wanted to take some autoimmune tests, saying that it would be a good idea to rule that out.  I have read about this, and that scares me alot, and I just think that I would like to follow the advice of the first doctor that I liked, and assume it's fatty liver.  This new doctor was not really friendly and sort of acted annoyed by my questions, don't you hate that?  Anyway, I was just kind of wondering how common it is to have raised liver enzymes with fatty liver, and if autoimmune testing is routine with these raised enzymes.  I don't really have any other symptoms, except that I am overweight, and I think the other doctor just put two and two together, with my weight, the sonogram, and all the other blood tests coming back normal.  I do get tired alot, but then I stay up all night!  Thanks in advance, and sorry to have written so much!!  Valerie

Hi again, and sorry, I forgot about one thing that I wanted to ask.  I was taking an aspirn a day for some heart palpitations that I had, the cardiologist said I had a brief episode of atrial fibrillation is the reason for the aspirin a day, but I stopped taking it when I found out my enzymes were high cause I didn't want to take anything at all.  I called my cardiologist the other day to explain the situation, and the nurse called back and said that I should at least take a baby aspirin a day if that's ok with my GI.  I'll call my GI with this question, but I was just wondering if you think it's ok to take a baby aspirin per day.  The first doctor I went to said aspirin would not raise your liver enzymes (that was the regular doctor, not the first GI).  The hard part is, I don't really have a GI to call yet, cause my first one left the area, and I don't have another one yet, at least one that I like.  Thanks Again!!  Val

question: I am currently 5 months pregnant.  LAte into my 3rd month, I started experiencing sharp pain in the area of my Gall Bladder.  Concerned that I may have gallstones, my OB decided that I should have an ultrasound of the Gall Bladder.  at the ultrasound they took images of the gall bladder along with the liver and kidneys.  My OB called me yesterday to inform me that I do not have gallstones but he is concerned that my liver appears to be a bit larger than normal.  He stated that there are no lesions or tumors on the liver. He wants me to take a Liver function test.  And he said it could be possible that although slightly larger, this may be a normal size liver for me.I do not drink or smoke or use any drugs.  I've never been at risk for AIDS (OB performed test for it anyway and it came back fine).  I do take 1/2 of a 25mg of Atenonol for tachycardia which was prescribed by my cardiologist.  The only over the counter medication that I take is Tylenol for occasional headaches or muscle pain.Can it be possible that the pregnancy caused the liver to enlarge?  What are some reasons for the liver to enlarge?  What other tests are available to make certain that my liver is healthy, functioning properly, and the size is appropriate for me?Thanks in advance for any information.
title: Unltrasound Finds an Enlarged Liver
